sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"管理，支配"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: control, direct, govern, manage, rule, supervise, administer
means: control ： 含义广泛的常用词，指对人或物施以约束或控制的力量。
direct ： 侧重行使领导或指导权。
govern ： 侧重指运用任何控制的权力来统治或管理一个国家、一个社会或一个部门，暗含能力和知识的运用。
manage ： 强调对具体事务机构进行管理，有时含受权管理或处理之意。
rule ： 强调用绝对或独裁的权力来管理或统治。
supervise ： 侧重指运用本身的或被授予的权力来管理、检查工作，含监督意味。
administer ： 指官方的或正式的对事务的管理。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"法同，法规"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: law, constitution, regulation, code, rule, act
means: law ： 普通用词，泛指由最高当局所制订、立法机构所通过的任何成文或不成文的法规或条例。
constitution ： 指治理国家或国家在处理内外政务时所遵循的基本法律和原则；也指规章规则的汇集。
regulation ： 普通用词，指用于管理、指导或控制某系统或组织的规则、规定或原则等。
code ： 指某一阶层或社会所遵守的一整套法典、法规或法则；也可指与某一特殊活动或主题有关的规则。
rule ： 通常指机关、团体的规章、条例或比赛规则；也指对人行为、方法等所作的规定，还可指习俗所承认的规定。
act ： 指经立法机构通过并由行政管理签署的法案。

sentence.Network_en: Ministers took the floor to denounce the decision to suspend constitutional rule.
sentence.Network_cn: 几位部长发言谴责暂停宪制的决定。

sentence.Network_cn: 高官们可能会策划一场政变来复辟独裁统治。

sentence.Network_en: The North has been under Communist rule since 1954.
sentence.Network_cn: 北方自1954年起就一直处于共产党的统治之下。

phrase.cizu_name: make it a rule to do something

jx.jx_en_mean: have it as a habit or general principle to do something

lj.lj_ly: I make it a rule never to mix business with pleasure.
lj.lj_ls: 我习惯于从不把工作和娱乐弄混。

jx.jx_en_mean: the restriction of the arbitrary exercise of power by subordinating it to well-defined and established laws
a broadly accurate guide or principle, based on experience or practice rather than theory
jx.jx_cn_mean: 经验法则，凭经验或实践得来的法则

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, humorous)used to express one's enthusiasm for the specified person or thing

(英)粗略检查（是否正确或恰当）

jx.jx_en_mean: exclude (or include) something as a possibility

lj.lj_ls: 首相排除了11月份进行选举的可能性。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French reule (noun), reuler (verb), from late Latin regulare, from Latin regula 'straight stick'

encyclopedia.content: 歌曲简介 Ayumi Hamasaki2009年第一张全新单曲「Rule/Sparkle」 其中，主打曲《Rule》应邀成为由20世纪福克斯发行 的好莱坞真人版电影《Dragonball:Evolution（龙珠： 全新进化）》的全球版主题曲，并由滨崎步本人亲自创作。 并邀请漫画《七龙珠》原作者鸟山明先生亲自设计此次 单曲CD盘面。 此外，《Dragonball:Evolution》将于3月13日开始全球首映。 而另一首主打曲《Sparkle》则代言本田新款汽车Spark。 敬请期待~！ 歌曲歌词

entry.def: Rules are instructions that tell you what you are allowed to do and what you are not allowed to do.

example.ex: ...a thirty-two-page pamphlet explaining the rules of basketball...
example.tran: 说明篮球规则的32页的小册子

example.ex: Sikhs were expected to adhere strictly to the religious rules concerning appearance...
example.tran: 锡克教徒应当严格遵守该教对外表的规定。

entry.tran: 行事准则;指导方针;应做的事
entry.def: A rule is a statement telling people what they should do in order to achieve success or a benefit of some kind.

example.ex: An important rule is to drink plenty of water during any flight...
example.tran: 一条重要的原则就是每次坐飞机都要多喝水。

example.ex: By and large, the rules for healthy eating are the same during pregnancy as at any other time.
example.tran: 总的来说，怀孕期间健康饮食的原则和其他时期是一致的。

entry.def: The rules of something such as a language or a science are statements that describe the way that things usually happen in a particular situation.

example.ex: It is a rule of English that adjectives generally precede the noun they modify.
example.tran: 形容词一般放在所修饰名词的前面是英语中的一条规律。

example.ex: ...according to the rules of quantum theory.

entry.def: If something is the rule, it is the normal state of affairs.

example.ex: However, for many Americans today, weekend work has unfortunately become the rule rather than the exception.
example.tran: 然而，现在对于很多美国人来说，周末工作不幸已经成为了一种普遍情况，而非例外。

entry.def: The person or group that rules a country controls its affairs.

example.ex: For four centuries, he says, foreigners have ruled Angola...
example.tran: 他说，外来者统治安哥拉的时间已长达4个世纪。

entry.def: If something rules your life, it influences or restricts your actions in a way that is not good for you.

example.ex: Scientists have always been aware of how fear can rule our lives and make us ill.
example.tran: 科学家一直都很清楚恐惧会影响我们的生活，引起我们身体的不适。

entry.def: When someone in authority rules that something is true or should happen, they state that they have officially decided that it is true or should happen.

example.ex: The court ruled that laws passed by the assembly remained valid...
example.tran: 法院裁定议会通过的法律仍然有效。

example.ex: The Israeli court has not yet ruled on the case...
example.tran: 以色列法院尚未对此案作出裁决。

entry.def: If you rule a straight line, you draw it using something that has a straight edge.

example.ex: ...a ruled grid of horizontal and vertical lines.
example.tran: 由水平线和垂直线画成的格子

entry.def: If you say that something happens as a rule, you mean that it usually happens.

example.ex: As a rule, however, such attacks have been aimed at causing damage rather than taking life.
example.tran: 然而，通常此类袭击只是为了造成破坏，并非要人性命。

example.ex: As a general rule, burglars are wary about gaining entry from the front or side of a building.
example.tran: 通常来说，窃贼对从房屋的正面或侧面潜入会比较谨慎。

entry.tran: 变通规则;放松规定;通融
entry.def: If someone in authority bends the rules or stretches the rules, they do something even though it is against the rules.

example.ex: There is a particular urgency in this case, and it would help if you could bend the rules.
example.tran: 这次碰巧有紧急情况，如果您能通融一下就好了。

entry.tran: (根据实际经验的)粗略估算;经验之谈
entry.def: A rule of thumb is a rule or principle that you follow which is not based on exact calculations, but rather on experience.

example.ex: A good rule of thumb is that a broker must generate sales of ten times his salary if his employer is to make a profit...
example.tran: 根据经验来看，如果雇主要获得利润，那么其代理商必须卖出相当于其工资10倍的销售额。

example.ex: As a rule of thumb, a cup of filter coffee contains about 80mg of caffeine.
example.tran: 凭经验估计，一杯过滤咖啡约含80毫克咖啡因。

entry.def: If workers work to rule, they protest by working according to the rules of their job without doing any extra work or taking any new decisions.

example.ex: Nurses are continuing to work to rule.

means.word_mean: 1. a principle or condition that customarily governs behavior;

sentences.sentence: "it was his rule to take a walk before breakfast"

means.word_mean: 2. something regarded as a normative example;

sentences.sentence: "the convention of not naming the main character"
"violence is the rule not the exception"

means.word_mean: 3. prescribed guide for conduct or action
4. (linguistics) a rule describing (or prescribing) a linguistic practice
5. a basic generalization that is accepted as true and that can be used as a basis for reasoning or conduct;

sentences.sentence: "their principles of composition characterized all their works"

means.word_mean: 6. a rule or law concerning a natural phenomenon or the function of a complex system;

sentences.sentence: "the principle of the conservation of mass"

means.word_mean: 7. the duration of a monarch's or government's power;
8. dominance or power through legal authority;

sentences.sentence: "France held undisputed dominion over vast areas of Africa"

means.word_mean: 9. directions that define the way a game or sport is to be conducted;
10. any one of a systematic body of regulations defining the way of life of members of a religious order;
11. (mathematics) a standard procedure for solving a class of mathematical problems;

sentences.sentence: "he determined the upper bound with Descartes' rule of signs"
"he gave us a general formula for attacking polynomials"

means.word_mean: 12. measuring stick consisting of a strip of wood or metal or plastic with a straight edge that is used for drawing straight lines and measuring lengths
1. exercise authority over; as of nations;
2. decide with authority;

sentences.sentence: "The King decreed that all first-born males should be killed"

means.word_mean: 3. be larger in number, quantity, power, status or importance;
4. decide on and make a declaration about;
5. have an affinity with; of signs of the zodiac
6. mark or draw with a ruler;
7. keep in check;

example.en: It is a case of tobacco industry rules, O.K.
example.zh: 这是烟草行业必胜的一例。

Sentence.sentence: Display and sales restrictions: California has a rule prohibiting alcohol displays near the cash registers in gas stations, and in most places you can't buy alcohol at drive-through facilities.
What is the purpose of California's rule about alcohol display in gas stations
The danger is that although some rules need to be updated to protect consumers from harm, existing rental businesses will try to destroy competition

It seems very good for Harvard to honor such a high profile popularizer of the irrational…… at a time when political and religious nonsense so jeopardize the rule of reason in this allegedly enlightened democracy and around the world.
Rule against Monsanto's excessive extension of its patent rights.
They are also hoping the court's ruling will rein in patent law, which is increasingly being used to claim new life forms as private property.

means.word_mean: 规则, 规章, 规定, 条例

sentences.en: You should be observant of the traffic rules.

means.word_mean: 习惯; 惯常的做法; 常规

sentences.en: She makes a rule of going for a walk every afternoon.
sentences.cn: 她有每天下午散步的习惯。

means.word_mean: 统治; 管理; 支配; 控制

sentences.en: These are the countries that were once under French rule.
sentences.cn: 这些是曾由法国统治的国家。

means.word_mean: 尺, 折尺

sentences.en: Use a rule to measure the width of that cloth.
sentences.cn: 用尺子量一下那块布的宽度。

means.word_mean: 统治; 控制;  操纵; 支配

sentences.cn: 很显然经济力量起决定作用。

sentences.en: The King ruled his people well and wisely.
sentences.cn: 这位国王贤明地统治着他的臣民。

means.word_mean: 判定, 裁定, 判决

sentences.en: The king rules in that country.
sentences.cn: 那个国家一切听从国王裁决。

sentences.en: The judge ruled that the witness (should) be heard.
sentences.cn: 那位法官裁定要传唤证人问话。

means.word_mean: 用尺子划; 在…上划平行线; 用直尺等画（线）; 画（直线）

sentences.en: He ruled the test paper carefully.
sentences.cn: 他小心地在考卷上画直线。

jushi.english: Everything has been done in accordance with the rules.
jushi.chinese: 一切都是按规定进行的。

jushi.english: It has been a rule for years never to interrupt father in the morning.
jushi.chinese: 多年来我们从不在早上打搅父亲。

jushi.english: He broke the rule that family discord should never reach the ears of outsiders.
jushi.chinese: 他打破了家庭不和不可外扬的惯例。
